title: UC Berkeley in lockdown as anti-Trump protesters hurl fireworks, smash windows and start fires
text:
Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
One of America's most prestigious universities was put in lockdown after a protest against a far-right speaker and Trump supporter turned violent. 
Hundreds of anti-fascists had gathered to voice their objection to the appearance of Breibart News editor Milo Yiannopoulos - a prominent supporter of President Trump. 
But hours before he was due to appear, the scene turned violent when a number of masked anarchists began hurling fireworks into the building. Hundreds of protesters gathered to oppose the speech by Yiannopoulos (Photo: Fox10 Phoenix) A lamppost was pulled down and fires started (Photo: Fox10 Phoenix) The university said it was on lockdown as police ordered the crowd to disperse (Photo: Fox10 Phoenix) 
A lamppost was pulled down and a generator set on fire as the scene grew increasingly tense. 
Police warned the crowd to disperse and appeared to fire rubber bullets. 
School officials said on Twitter after the protest erupted that the speech by Yiannopoulos had been canceled and that the campus was on lockdown. Chaos in Berkeley (Photo: Fox10 Phoenix) Protesters aimed fireworks into the building (Photo: Fox10 Phoenix) A similar protest forced a speech by Yiannopoulos to be cancelled just weeks ago (Photo: Fox10 Phoenix) 
Yiannopoulos wrote on his Facebook page: "I have been evacuated from the UC Berkely campus after violent left-wing protestors tore down barricades, lit fires, threw rocks and Roman candles at the windows and breached the ground floor of the building. 
"My team and I are safe. But the event has been cancelled." 
A similar protest led to a speech by Yiannopoulos being cancelled at the University of California Davis just weeks ago. Like us on Facebook
